item.title: Best Handheld Marvel Games, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Marvel games thrive in the handheld gaming world, offering diverse experiences for fans on the go or at home.
  • Guardians of the Galaxy shines but hits a snag on the Switch, showcasing the importance of platform choice.
  • From LEGO Marvel fun to competitive fighting game experiences, there's a Marvel handheld title for every fan.

Marvel has a long and storied history in the gaming industry, and its popularity in the modern age only serves to cement the future of Marvel games. Alongside that, handheld gaming is becoming more and more prevalent, be it handheld consoles like the Nintendo Switch or the ever-accessible nature of mobile gaming.

It's no surprise, then, that there are plenty of excellent handheld titles for Marvel fans, offering multiple avenues to experience a wide range of Marvel games on the go or from the comfort of the sofa. From fighting games all the way to strategy games, and everything in between, there has never been a better time to be a handheld gaming fan that loves Marvel.

8 Guardians of the Galaxy

A Great Game, But With Drawbacks On The Switch

Guardians of the Galaxy is based on the Marvel comic franchise of the same name. It inherits the traits that have made both the comics and films so popular, with brilliant characters, an excellent soundtrack, and flashy, inspired visuals. All of this is coupled with fun and unique gameplay, utilizing a system in which players can use Starlord to command other members of the Guardians into special team-up moves.

The downside, however, is specifically within the Nintendo Switch version of the game. While it is the same game, and offers all the positives of the other systems, players and critics alike regularly experience issues with the Switch version, given that it can only be played through cloud gaming. Players have reported performance issues and lag, resulting in an unreliable handheld experience that fails to capture the flair that other systems provide.

7 Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order

A Fun and Cooperative Marvel Experience

Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order is a Nintendo Switch exclusive revival of the beloved Marvel Ultimate Alliance series. Released 10 years on from the previous title, it was welcomed into a gaming climate that loves Marvel media more than ever.

Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order draws inspiration from all over Marvel comics and films. Character designs are pulled straight from the pages of the comics, such as the designs of Spider-Man and Hawkeye, or straight from the Marvel Cinematic Universe, as seen with Rocket Raccoon. It couples this dense character roster with flashy and exciting gameplay, made all the more fun with the ability to play with up to three friends. Whilst simplistic, Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3: The Black Order offers an exciting handheld Marvel experience that can be played on the go and with friends.

6 LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2

A Multiversal Marvel LEGO Adventure

LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 continues the fun and silly fan service of its predecessor, allowing players to take control of their favorite Marvel heroes throughout various levels and the new open world hub, Chronopolis. It all takes place in a comedic and family-friendly setting.

LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a well-regarded title by critics and players, offering fun and creative versions of well-known and obscure Marvel characters alike. The game also introduces multiple levels that were direct tie-ins to Marvel films, including Black Panther and Avengers: Infinity War . Despite the game's success, some players have argued that the weaker voice acting and less interesting open world mark LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 as a notable step down from its predecessor. This sentiment is echoed by the differing review scores for both games. Nonetheless, LEGO Marvel Super Heroes 2 is a fun and lighthearted handheld title for any Marvel fan.

5 Marvel Contest of Champions

Intense Fighting And An Expansive Roster

Marvel Contest of Champions is a free-to-play mobile fighting game that offers an accessible and fun fighting experience on-the-go, boasting a roster of over 250 beloved Marvel characters. Whilst players may find the title simplistic when compared to other, more competitive fighting games, it cannot be denied that Marvel Contest of Champions provides a fast-paced and fun casual fighting game experience.

The large roster ensures players are likely to find at least one of their favorite Marvel characters to play. The Marvel license, along with the mobile nature of the game, allows for an accessible and stylized fighting game that is perfect for gamers who want that Marvel action fix whilst traveling or away from their home consoles.

4 Marvel Future Fight

The Definitive Marvel ARPG

  • Platforms: IOS, Android
  • Released: April 30, 2015
  • Developer: Netmarble Monster
  • Genre: Action-Roleplaying, Dungeoncrawler

Marvel Future Fight is a mobile action RPG with a focus on collecting and upgrading a plethora of Marvel characters to tackle various pieces of content, be they PvE or PvP. The game has a diverse and expansive roster of over 270 Marvel characters.

Marvel Future Fight offers a deeper mobile experience than gamers may initially expect. The game includes rich characterization, with an ever-evolving meta that keeps players engaged. It is free-to-play, and while it suffers from the monetization that many mobile titles do, the game provides players with a wealth of content for both free and paid players. Alongside this, the game has an expansive story and even prequel tie-in comics, allowing for a narrative experience alongside the gameplay. The handheld format allows for a compelling and deep on-the-go gaming experience for any Marvel fan.

3 LEGO Marvel Super Heroes

Equal Parts Funny And Action-Packed

LEGO Marvel Super Heroes is one game in the long line of licensed LEGO titles that continue to hold a beloved and dedicated fanbase. As the first Marvel LEGO game, it exists as a monument to how expansive and deep the Marvel universe is. It offers a roster that spans The Fantastic Four, The Avengers, The X-Men, and many more.

It combines family-friendly humor and a simplistic but engaging gameplay loop to provide a perfect lighthearted, casual gaming experience when played on a handheld console like the Nintendo Switch. LEGO Marvel Super Heroes includes a large open world set within Manhattan. This large city-scape allows players to live out the superhero fantasy, be it flying around as Iron Man or swinging from buildings as Spider-Man. It combines the signature LEGO style with beloved Marvel characters to provide a fun title, perfect for handheld gaming.

2 Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3

A Competitive Fighting Game Experience

Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3 is a unique title, but one beloved by players nonetheless. It pits characters of the Marvel universe alongside and against characters from Capcom games to create a truly unique fighting game experience. Its position as the third entry in the series allows for Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3 to build upon the established formula set by the first two games.

Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3 , specifically the PS Vita version, allows for a deep and mechanically complex fighting game, all whilst on a handheld console. The roster of fighters provides the game with its unique selling point in the fighting game market, allowing for unlikely crossovers, such as Phoenix Wright versus Wolverine or Wesker versus Thor. For Marvel fans looking for a competitive fighting game experience on the go, they can't go wrong with Ultimate Marvel vs. Capcom 3.

1 Marvel Snap

Card Collection Meets Intense Strategy

Marvel Snap is a free-to-play mobile card game, coupling an extensive roster of Marvel characters with a unique and strategic card-battler. It offers a compelling experience for both Marvel fans and gamers who enjoy the card game format.

Marvel Snap features card collecting, deck building and card upgrading as the crux of its progression. Players then bring their cards into a match against other players or the computer and attempt to win rounds through having a higher attack sum on the majority of the three lanes. Marvel Snap has modifiers on each lane that allow for a diverse match-to-match experience, requiring a good deck as well as plenty of strategy in the moment. Marvel Snap is praised by players and critics as it allows for a competitive card-battler experience alongside a roster of nearly 300 cards to collect and upgrade, all from the convenience of a mobile device.

item.title: Diablo 4: All The Mother's Gifts Rewards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Mother's Gifts Rewards In Diablo 4: Season 5
  • How To Rank Up Mother's Gift's Fast

Each season of Diablo 4 introduces a new item that players will need to farm in order to rank up their seasonal rewards. In Season 5, players will be collecting Mother's Gifts to give them to Istel and receiving the Mother's Gifts.

Upon starting the seasonal content, players can complete the first mission, Of Wolves and Lambs, unlocking the seasonal rewards. This will also have Mother's Gifts start spawning throughout the world, which are collected to increase your Mother's Gifts rank and get twenty rewards.

All Mother's Gifts Rewards In Diablo 4: Season 5

After completing Of Wolves And Lambs, Istel will move to a building right next to the blacksmith in Zarbinzet , and talking to her will show players want rank they are at in the seasonal rewards, along with how many Mother's Gifts they have. Mother's Gifts are not lost or spent and will continue to build up and unlock additional ranks as you kill powerful enemies throughout the season.

Season Ranking

Rewards

1

  • 5,000 XP.
  • Triune Parcel: Common crafting materials and items such as those for Elixirs.

2

  • Magic Triune Crate: Contains powerful and common crafting materials.
  • Seasonal Quest 2/6: The Past Behind Us.

3

  • Rare Triune Arms Cache: Contains rare gear for your current character.
  • Seasonal Quest 3/6: The Seething Mountain.

4

  • Magic Triune Crate: Contains powerful and common crafting materials.
  • Seasonal Quest 4/6: An Old And Angry Wound.

5

  • Rare Triune Arms Cache: Contains Rare gear for your current character.
  • Seasonal Quest 5/6: Sins Of The Willing.

6

  • Sacred Triune Arms Cache: Contains a Sacred Legendary item with 650 power.
  • Seasonal Quest 6/6: The Wages Of Hate.

7

  • Magic Triune Crate: Contains powerful and common crafting materials.

8

  • Infernal Compasses that grant access to tier 2 of the Infernal Hordes.

9

  • Magic Triune Crafte: Contains powerful and common crafting materials.

10

  • Ancestral Triune Arms Cache: Contains an Ancestral Legendary with 800 item power.

11

  • Ancestral Rare Triune Strongbox: Contains powerful and rare crafting materials.

12

  • Ancestral Rare Triune Strongbox: Contains powerful and rare crafting materials.

13

  • Rare Elements Of Hatred: Contains herbs, salvage, and equipment.

14

  • Ancestral Rare Triune Strongbox: Contains powerful and rare crafting materials.
  • Abyssal Scroll: Upgrades an Infernal Compass to the next tier

15

  • Ancestral Unique Triune Strongbox Of Endurant Faith: Contains the Endurant Faith Unique Gloves with 850 item power, with additional powerful crafting materials.

16

  • Ancestral Rare Triune Strongbox: Contains powerful and rare crafting materials.

17

  • Rare Elements Of Hatred: Rare equipment for your current character.

18

  • Ancestral Triune Arms Cache: Contains an Ancestral Legendary with 925 power.

19

  • Elements of Nemesis: Contains summon items to summon endgame bosses.

20

  • Ancestral Mythic Unique Greater Triune Arms Cache: Contains an Ancestral Legendary with 925 power and two Greater Affixes and a Resplendent Spark.

How To Rank Up Mother's Gift's Fast

Some of these rewards are incredibly strong and can skyrocket the strength of a character by getting them. To quickly rank up and get Mother's Gifts, players will need to focus heavily on finding and killing the biggest demons they can . This is best done by fighting in Hellbreaches or against the Infernal Hordes, which are both new activities introduced in the new season. Players can also rank up fairly fast by farming enemies during the Helltide and causing the Hellborne demons to spawn.

item.title: Creatures of Ava: How to Clear Moving Vines
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Clear Moving Vines in Creatures of Ava
  • How to Use Dhom Spell in Creatures of Ava

The world of Creatures of Ava features many environments that, alongside introducing local creatures, will also introduce several obstacles that will prevent you from moving forward or accessing permanent upgrades for your gear. The Nafitar staff will help you out most of the time, but you will probably need to discover new powers and spells when visiting new areas.

One of those obstacles you will encounter is the Moving Vines. These will bait you toward a seemingly open pathway just to block the way as soon as you get close by. Thankfully, one of the many Sagestones in Creatures of Ava will grant your staff the ability to clear them, but you will have to do some things beforehand.

How to Clear Moving Vines in Creatures of Ava

While the Moving Vines are not as common as other obstacles present in the early game, they do appear in the first area in Creatures of Ava the Grasslands in a limited capacity. To clear the Moving Vines, you will need to travel to the second area in the game, which is the Jungle . To do so, you must complete all main quests in the Grasslands and also complete their corresponding Rescue Quest, which will have you use your Flute to tame creatures and save them with your Rescue Robots.

Once you complete said task, you will be directed toward the Jungle. You will first have to make a stop in the Jungle village and get a new Flute alongside a new song called the " Song of Vines ." This will allow you to traverse through the Jungle by controlling the local creatures and opening up the way to the Jungle temple where you will find a new Sagestone that will empower your staff. The way toward the temple is plagued by infected creatures, so make sure to use your Staff and its spells to your advantage and survive.

As per usual, to empower your Nafitar staff, you must complete a puzzle by rotating and aligning puzzle pieces to form a mosaic. The Sagestone will then grant you a new spell that will allow you to clear the Moving Vines by using your Nafitar staff: the Dhom spell.

How to Use Dhom Spell in Creatures of Ava

The Dhom spell , rather than clearing the Moving Vines per se, will freeze their movement for a limited amount of time. To correctly use it, be sure to bring up the Spell wheel by pressing RT and selecting the Dhom spell. Once you encounter Moving Vines in Creatures of Ava , position yourself where the vines are up, use your Staff beam to connect with the crystal above them, and tap the Dhom spell button to stop the vines from moving. They will remain in place for a brief moment, allowing you to go through them.

Just like the Krist spell that clears Yellow Witherbloom, the Dhom spell can also be used to freeze creatures in place to give yourself a break if multiple infected creatures are surrounding you at once. Use this in conjunction with Ushun to keep infected enemies in check while you cleanse them from the withering infection, which will then enable you to tame and control them.

That said, the effect of the Dhom spell is pretty limited when applied to infected creatures, and some puzzles in Creatures of Ava might require more time than the default Dhom spell effect provides. To circumvent this, you can allocate skill points to upgrade the effects of the Dhom spell, making infected creatures and Moving Vines frozen in place for longer. Moreover, if you are having issues with the late-game infected creature encounters, the Dhom III upgrade allows you to reset your freeze timer after using other spells, which can be a lifesaver.

item.title: Where to Find the House of Grief in Baldur's Gate 3
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Find the House of Grief in Baldur's Gate 3
  • How to Start the House of Grief Quests in Baldur's Gate 3
  • How to Investigate the House of Grief
  • Completing Shadowheart's Quest at the House of Grief

In Baldur's Gate 3 , there are several tasks that feature multiple possible paths to a conclusion. Discovering and investigating the House of Grief is one such task. In the later stages of the game, players can find themselves with more than one quest that tasks them with locating the House of Grief, with Shadowheart's questline being the most obvious. However, players who are not following Shadowheart's quest can also encounter a completely separate side-quest that tasks them with investigating the House of Grief. Completing one or both of these quests can prove tricky, as BG3 offers players very little to go on. With this in mind, this guide will show players how to locate and investigate the House of Grief in Baldur's Gate 3.

Where to Find the House of Grief in Baldur's Gate 3

The House of Grief is found in the northwest corner of Baldur's Gate. From the Baldur's Gate Waypoint, look for Lady Jannath's Estate, which is shown on the above map. It is far more likely that players have revealed this location than the House of Grief. From the estate, you'll need to head north into a small courtyard, where you'll find Arves, and the House of Grief.

How to Start the House of Grief Quests in Baldur's Gate 3

As previously mentioned, there are two quests that task the player with reaching the House of Grief in BG3. The first is Shadowheart's main quest. Over the course of the game, players who follow her questline will realize that many of Shadowheart's memories have been stripped from her, leaving her in a perpetual state of uncertainty and confusion. At first, she hides this fact behind a guise of piety and confidence that makes the player think she is simply a devout follower of Shar. As events unfold, however, cracks in the facade begin to show. Regardless of the path players take with Shadowheart, by the time they reach the city of Baldur's Gate, visiting the House of Grief will be required.

If players avoid following Shadowheart's quest entirely, there is another quest that will require a visit to the House of Grief. Like Shadowheart's quest into the house, this too requires players to make their way to Baldur's Gate. In the northwest corner of the city map, you'll find Lady Jannath's estate. Just past this location, players will find an older man named Arves . He has completely lost his memory, and after talking to him, the game prompts the player to "Investigate the House of Grief." However, what this actually entails is not made clear.

It is important to note that, for the most part, Shadowheart will be required to actually see this quest through to completion. Knowing Larian, there is likely a path to completing the side-quest without Shadowheart. However, the fact that she is tied to the location, makes it far easier to simply take her.

How to Investigate the House of Grief

When you reach Arves, you'll actually be right next to the House of Grief. If you enter with Shadowheart, and speak to Mirie at the front desk, you'll be ushered into the back without much fuss. But if you enter without Shadowheart, you'll need to pay 1000 gold to enter the backroom.

Once you enter the back room, sit on the granite bench that sits directly in the center. Doing this will cause the Mother Superior, Viconia DeVir, to appear. Again, it is much faster to complete this task if Shadowheart is with you. If she is not present, you'll have to return with her to enter the cloister. If you head into the corner of the room, an investigation check occurs, which appears to reveal the hidden switch that opens the chamber. This makes it possible to enter without Shadowheart. However, it is a difficult check to pass, and is not required at all if Shadowheart is with you.

When you reach the cloister's main chamber, and speak with the Mother Superior, Investigate the House of Grief will be completed. There does not seem to be any resolution to Arves' situation.

Completing Shadowheart's Quest at the House of Grief

Shadowheart's goal at the House of Grief is to find her parents, and this is only possible through a fight. If Shadowheart decides to defy Shar, you will have to fight every Sharran in the building. There are several possible outcomes for Shadowheart in Baldur's Gate 3, but defeating the Mother Superior and the rest of the Sharrans, as well as deciding what to do with her parents, will conclude her time at the House of Grief for all intents and purposes.

item.title: 10 Forgotten Heroes In Classic PS1 Games
item.description:
The PS1 generation was experimental, as the console was one of the first video game systems to support 3D graphics technology. For this reason, developers took the opportunity to release a variety of games, many of which are still part of popular franchises today. And many of those games spawned beloved characters.

Names like Cloud Strife from Final Fantasy 7 , Leon S. Kennedy from Resident Evil , or even Alucard, the protagonist of Castlevania: Symphony of the Night , are still remembered among players. However, many other incredible heroes from classic PS1 games have been forgotten over tim e, either because the franchise was abandoned by developers or because more popular characters overshadowed them. Here are a few who deserve a spotlight.

10 Aya Brea (Parasite Eve)

The New York Detective Who Faced Biological Terror

Aya Brea, the protagonist of Parasite Eve , is a New York detective who faces a mysterious biological enemy during the Christmas festivities. Released for the PlayStation 1, the game combined RPG and horror elements, creating a unique and innovative experience for players. Aya, with her enigmatic past and unique abilities, became an icon of the genre.

Despite being a forgotten heroine, Aya Brea brought emotional depth and an engaging narrative that set Parasite Eve apart from other games of the time. The dark atmosphere and the blend of science and biological horror made the game a PlayStation 1 classic. Today it is fondly remembered by fans, even though it did not maintain the same popularity over the years.

9 Dart (Legend Of Dragoon)

A Game Released At The End Of The Playstation 1's Life

Despite having many qualities that make it one of the best RPGs on the PlayStation 1, The Legend of Dragoon was released at the end of the console's life when players were already migrating to the next generation. Thus, Dart, the game's protagonist, was also doomed to become a forgotten hero over time.

Dart Feld is a young warrior with a heavy heart who survived the destruction of his hometown, Neet, by the mysterious Black Monster. Driven by a desire for revenge, he embarks on an epic journey that leads him to become a Dragoon, a warrior with magical abilities and the power to transform into a mighty dragon. Despite captivating many players, the game failed to achieve the popularity of other franchises of the time.

8 Serge (Chrono Cross)

Protagonist Of A Sequel To Chrono Trigger

Produced by what was considered the Dream Team of the time, Chrono Trigger was released for the Nintendo console and marked a generation. On the PlayStation 1, the game had an official sequel called Chrono Cross , which featured a protagonist named Serge.

Unfortunately, despite having good concepts, Chrono Cross failed to engage fans as much. It was difficult to compete with the charisma and quality achieved by Chrono Trigger . Additionally, Chrono Cross abandoned several concepts that made the first game famous, such as time travel. It also sidelined the main characters of Chrono Trigger for much of the game, contributing to its low popularity.

7 Justin (Grandia)

The Young Adventurer In Search Of Legends

Justin is the protagonist of Grandia , a classic JRPG released for the PlayStation 1 that follows the journey of a young adventurer in search of ancient legends and treasures. With a fearless spirit, a pure heart, and a strong sense of curiosity, Justin embarks on an epic journey around the world, meeting allies and facing dangers.

Although Grandia was a classic game appreciated for its captivating narrative and innovative combat system, Justin did not achieve the same fame as other RPG protagonists of the time, becoming a forgotten hero. The richness of the story and the development of the characters made Grandia an important milestone in the PlayStation 1's game library, fondly remembered by dedicated fans.

6 Ashley Riot (Vagrant Story)

Forgotten Hero Of A Great Isometric RPG

Ashley Riot was the protagonist of Vagrant Story , a game produced by the same team that made Final Fantasy Tactics . However, unlike Ramza Beoulve, who is still remembered by fans of the franchise, Ashley has more modest popularity. In the game's story, the character was an elite agent who needed to investigate a political conspiracy in the dark catacombs of Le Monde.

The character, remembered for his excellent fighting skills, was interesting. However, even though Vagrant Story is constantly cited as a hidden gem of the PlayStation 1, it has not received new games or remakes for modern consoles. This has caused Ashley Riot, despite his depth, to become a forgotten character among players.

5 Vahn (Legend Of Legaia)

A Game With Unique Combat

Legend of Legaia had one of the most fun combat systems on the PlayStation 1, mixing traditional turn-based combat with combos reminiscent of fighting games. However, the story was filled with clichs, where a group of heroes needed to save the world and wielded magical items.

Although the game had a certain charm for its time, it did not survive the test of time. Thus, Vahn, the blue-haired boy who starred in the first game of the franchise, remained in the memory of players as a symbol of an innovative RPG for its era. However, the game is remembered more for its nostalgia than for its lasting impact on the gaming industry.

4 Fei Fong Wong (Xenogears)

One Of The Greatest Heroes Of JRPGs

Xenogears is a JRPG that stands out for its deep and complex narrative. The protagonist, Fei Fong Wong, is a young artist who is drawn into an epic struggle involving giant mechas, religion, and philosophical issues. Additionally, Fei discovers his dark past and faces existential dilemmas, making his journey memorable.

Despite its quality and depth, Xenogears did not achieve the same popularity as other titles of the time, leaving Fei Fong Wong as a forgotten hero among other great games that players could play. The lack of continuous recognition and the absence of direct sequels contributed to Xenogears becoming a hidden gem, appreciated only by a dedicated fan base.

3 Regina (Dino Crisis)

The Scientist Who Faced Dinosaurs

Regina is the protagonist of Dino Crisis , a survival horror game developed by Capcom. In the game, Regina is a special operations agent sent to investigate a research facility where dinosaurs have been brought back to life. Her intelligence, courage, and combat skills make her a memorable figure in the gaming world.

As a forgotten heroine, Regina represents an era of innovation in the horror genre. Dino Crisis , often compared to Resident Evil , brought a new kind of fear with its relentless dinosaurs and tense environment. Although Regina and her game did not achieve the same lasting fame, they remain an important milestone and a classic game of the PlayStation 1 era.

2 John Tanner (Driver 1)

The Undercover Cop On A Dangerous Mission

Tanner, the protagonist of Driver , is a former police officer who goes undercover to take down criminal organizations. This game was a pioneer in offering an open-world experience with intense car chases and an engaging narrative. Tanner, with his driving skills, became an unforgettable hero for the game's fans.

In addition to bringing a new dynamic to the genre, Driver became a great classic of past generations, thanks to the innovations it brought to the gameplay and the challenges of the missions. Although the franchise does not maintain the same popularity in modern times, John Tanner is still fondly remembered by many fans.

1 Edward Carnby (Alone In The Dark: The New Nightmare)

Forgotten Alone On The PlayStation 1

Alone in The Dark was one of the most important franchises for the horror genre in video games, bringing various concepts that were later used by other games. The first game of the franchise, which starred Edward Carnby and had a remake called Alone in the Dark: The New Nightmare for PlayStation 1, showcased this quality.

The Alone in the Dark franchise, despite its initial impact, could not keep up with the quality of other horror series that emerged later. Not even the remake released in 2024 helped revive interest in the game, leaving Edward Carnby even more forgotten. Thus, although the protagonist was interesting, he lost relevance over time, becoming just a memory for hardcore fans.
